trans-unit.source: Overlay tiled images on a map
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiled images on a map

trans-unit.source: Overlay third-party or custom tiled images on a map by using tile sources.
trans-unit.target: Overlay third-party or custom tiled images on a map by using tile sources.

trans-unit.source: Use tile sources to overlay specialized information such as weather data, population data, or seismic data; or use tile sources to replace the default map entirely.
trans-unit.target: Use tile sources to overlay specialized information such as weather data, population data, or seismic data; or use tile sources to replace the default map entirely.

trans-unit.source: Overlay tiled images on a map
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiled images on a map

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Overlay third-party or custom tiled images on a map by using tile sources.
trans-unit.target: Overlay third-party or custom tiled images on a map by using tile sources.

trans-unit.source: Use tile sources to overlay specialized information such as weather data, population data, or seismic data; or use tile sources to replace the default map entirely.
trans-unit.target: Use tile sources to overlay specialized information such as weather data, population data, or seismic data; or use tile sources to replace the default map entirely.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** To learn more about using maps in your app, download the following sample from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** To learn more about using maps in your app, download the following sample from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample

trans-unit.source: Tiled image overview
trans-unit.target: Tiled image overview

trans-unit.source: Map services such as Nokia Maps and Bing Maps cut maps into square tiles for quick retrieval and display.
trans-unit.target: Map services such as Nokia Maps and Bing Maps cut maps into square tiles for quick retrieval and display.

trans-unit.source: These tiles are 256 pixels by 256 pixels in size, and are pre-rendered at multiple levels of detail.
trans-unit.target: These tiles are 256 pixels by 256 pixels in size, and are pre-rendered at multiple levels of detail.

trans-unit.source: Many third-party services also provide map-based data that's cut into tiles.
trans-unit.target: Many third-party services also provide map-based data that's cut into tiles.

trans-unit.source: Use tile sources to retrieve third-party tiles, or to create your own custom tiles, and overlay them on the map displayed in the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).
trans-unit.target: Use tile sources to retrieve third-party tiles, or to create your own custom tiles, and overlay them on the map displayed in the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).

trans-unit.source: Important
trans-unit.target: Important

trans-unit.source: When you use tile sources, you don't have to write code to request or to position individual tiles.
trans-unit.target: When you use tile sources, you don't have to write code to request or to position individual tiles.

trans-unit.source: The [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004) requests tiles as it needs them.
trans-unit.target: The [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004) requests tiles as it needs them.

trans-unit.source: Each request specifies the X and Y coordinates and the zoom level for the individual tile.
trans-unit.target: Each request specifies the X and Y coordinates and the zoom level for the individual tile.

trans-unit.source: You simply specify the format of the Uri or filename to use to retrieve the tiles in the **UriFormatString** property.
trans-unit.target: You simply specify the format of the Uri or filename to use to retrieve the tiles in the **UriFormatString** property.

trans-unit.source: That is, you insert replaceable parameters in the base Uri or filename to indicate where to pass the X and Y coordinates and the zoom level for each tile.
trans-unit.target: That is, you insert replaceable parameters in the base Uri or filename to indicate where to pass the X and Y coordinates and the zoom level for each tile.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) property for an [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986) that shows the replaceable parameters for the X and Y coordinates and the zoom level.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) property for an [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986) that shows the replaceable parameters for the X and Y coordinates and the zoom level.

trans-unit.source: (The X and Y coordinates represent the location of the individual tile within the map of the world at the specified level of detail.
trans-unit.target: (The X and Y coordinates represent the location of the individual tile within the map of the world at the specified level of detail.

trans-unit.source: The tile numbering system starts from {0, 0} in the upper left corner of the map.
trans-unit.target: The tile numbering system starts from {0, 0} in the upper left corner of the map.

trans-unit.source: For example, the tile at {1, 2} is in the second column of the third row of the grid of tiles.)
trans-unit.target: For example, the tile at {1, 2} is in the second column of the third row of the grid of tiles.)

trans-unit.source: For more info about the tile system used by mapping services, see [Bing Maps Tile System](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=626692).
trans-unit.target: For more info about the tile system used by mapping services, see [Bing Maps Tile System](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=626692).

trans-unit.source: Overlay tiles from a tile source
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiles from a tile source

trans-unit.source: Overlay tiled images from a tile source on a map by using the [**MapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637141).
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiled images from a tile source on a map by using the [**MapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637141).

trans-unit.source: Instantiate one of the three tile data source classes that inherit from [**MapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637141).
trans-unit.target: Instantiate one of the three tile data source classes that inherit from [**MapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637141).

trans-unit.source: HttpMapTileDataSource
trans-unit.target: HttpMapTileDataSource

trans-unit.source: LocalMapTileDataSource
trans-unit.target: LocalMapTileDataSource

trans-unit.source: CustomMapTileDataSource
trans-unit.target: CustomMapTileDataSource

trans-unit.source: Configure the **UriFormatString** to use to request the tiles by inserting replaceable parameters in the base Uri or filename.
trans-unit.target: Configure the **UriFormatString** to use to request the tiles by inserting replaceable parameters in the base Uri or filename.

trans-unit.source: The following example instantiates an [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986).
trans-unit.target: The following example instantiates an [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986).

trans-unit.source: This example specifies the value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) in the constructor of the **HttpMapTileDataSource**.
trans-unit.target: This example specifies the value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) in the constructor of the **HttpMapTileDataSource**.

trans-unit.source: Instantiate and configure a [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144).
trans-unit.target: Instantiate and configure a [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144).

trans-unit.source: Specify the [**MapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637141) that you configured in the previous step as the [**DataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637149) of the **MapTileSource**.
trans-unit.target: Specify the [**MapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637141) that you configured in the previous step as the [**DataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637149) of the **MapTileSource**.

trans-unit.source: The following example specifies the [**DataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637149) in the constructor of the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144).
trans-unit.target: The following example specifies the [**DataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637149) in the constructor of the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144).

trans-unit.source: You can restrict the conditions in which the tiles are displayed by using properties of the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144).
trans-unit.target: You can restrict the conditions in which the tiles are displayed by using properties of the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144).

trans-unit.source: Display tiles only within a specific geographic area by providing a value for the [**Bounds**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637147) property.
trans-unit.target: Display tiles only within a specific geographic area by providing a value for the [**Bounds**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637147) property.

trans-unit.source: Display tiles only at certain levels of detail by providing a value for the [**ZoomLevelRange**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637171) property.
trans-unit.target: Display tiles only at certain levels of detail by providing a value for the [**ZoomLevelRange**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637171) property.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, configure other properties of the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144) that affect the loading or the display of the tiles, such as [**Layer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637157), [**AllowOverstretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637145), [**IsRetryEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637153), and [**IsTransparencyEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637155).
trans-unit.target: Optionally, configure other properties of the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144) that affect the loading or the display of the tiles, such as [**Layer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637157), [**AllowOverstretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637145), [**IsRetryEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637153), and [**IsTransparencyEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637155).

trans-unit.source: Add the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144) to the [**TileSources**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637053) collection of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).
trans-unit.target: Add the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144) to the [**TileSources**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637053) collection of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).

trans-unit.source: Overlay tiles from a web service
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiles from a web service

trans-unit.source: Overlay tiled images retrieved from a web service by using the [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986).
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiled images retrieved from a web service by using the [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986).

trans-unit.source: Instantiate an [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986).
trans-unit.target: Instantiate an [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986).

trans-unit.source: Specify the format of the Uri that the web service expects as the value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) property.
trans-unit.target: Specify the format of the Uri that the web service expects as the value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) property.

trans-unit.source: To create this value, insert replaceable parameters in the base Uri.
trans-unit.target: To create this value, insert replaceable parameters in the base Uri.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the following code sample, the value of the **UriFormatString** is:
trans-unit.target: For example, in the following code sample, the value of the **UriFormatString** is:

trans-unit.source: The web service has to support a Uri that contains the replaceable parameters {x}, {y}, and {zoomlevel}.
trans-unit.target: The web service has to support a Uri that contains the replaceable parameters {x}, {y}, and {zoomlevel}.

trans-unit.source: Most web services (for example, Nokia, Bing, and Google) support Uris in this format.
trans-unit.target: Most web services (for example, Nokia, Bing, and Google) support Uris in this format.

trans-unit.source: If the web service requires additional arguments that aren't available with the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) property, then you have to create a custom Uri.
trans-unit.target: If the web service requires additional arguments that aren't available with the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) property, then you have to create a custom Uri.

trans-unit.source: Create and return a custom Uri by handling the [**UriRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636993) event.
trans-unit.target: Create and return a custom Uri by handling the [**UriRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636993) event.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see the [Provide a custom URI](#customuri) section later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see the [Provide a custom URI](#customuri) section later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Then, follow the remaining steps described previously in the [Tiled image overview](#tileintro).
trans-unit.target: Then, follow the remaining steps described previously in the [Tiled image overview](#tileintro).

trans-unit.source: The following example overlays tiles from a fictitious web service on a map of North America.
trans-unit.target: The following example overlays tiles from a fictitious web service on a map of North America.

trans-unit.source: The value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) is specified in the constructor of the [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986).
trans-unit.target: The value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) is specified in the constructor of the [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986).

trans-unit.source: In this example, tiles are only displayed within the geographic boundaries specified by the optional [**Bounds**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637147) property.
trans-unit.target: In this example, tiles are only displayed within the geographic boundaries specified by the optional [**Bounds**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637147) property.

trans-unit.source: Overlay tiles from local storage
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiles from local storage

trans-unit.source: Overlay tiled images stored as files in local storage by using the [**LocalMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636994).
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiled images stored as files in local storage by using the [**LocalMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636994).

trans-unit.source: Typically, you package and distribute these files with your app.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you package and distribute these files with your app.

trans-unit.source: Instantiate a [**LocalMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636994).
trans-unit.target: Instantiate a [**LocalMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636994).

trans-unit.source: Specify the format of the file names as the value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636998) property.
trans-unit.target: Specify the format of the file names as the value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636998) property.

trans-unit.source: To create this value, insert replaceable parameters in the base filename.
trans-unit.target: To create this value, insert replaceable parameters in the base filename.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the following code sample, the value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) is:
trans-unit.target: For example, in the following code sample, the value of the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) is:

trans-unit.source: If the format of the file names requires additional arguments that aren't available with the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636998) property, then you have to create a custom Uri.
trans-unit.target: If the format of the file names requires additional arguments that aren't available with the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636998) property, then you have to create a custom Uri.

trans-unit.source: Create and return a custom Uri by handling the [**UriRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637001) event.
trans-unit.target: Create and return a custom Uri by handling the [**UriRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637001) event.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see the [Provide a custom URI](#customuri) section later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see the [Provide a custom URI](#customuri) section later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Then, follow the remaining steps described previously in the [Tiled image overview](#tileintro).
trans-unit.target: Then, follow the remaining steps described previously in the [Tiled image overview](#tileintro).

trans-unit.source: You can use the following protocols and locations to load tiles from local storage:
trans-unit.target: You can use the following protocols and locations to load tiles from local storage:

trans-unit.source: Uri
trans-unit.target: Uri

trans-unit.source: More info
trans-unit.target: More info

trans-unit.source: ms-appx:///
trans-unit.target: ms-appx:///

trans-unit.source: Points to the root of the app's installation folder.
trans-unit.target: Points to the root of the app's installation folder.

trans-unit.source: This is the location referenced by the [Package.InstalledLocation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224681) property.
trans-unit.target: This is the location referenced by the [Package.InstalledLocation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224681) property.

trans-unit.source: ms-appdata:///local
trans-unit.target: ms-appdata:///local

trans-unit.source: Points to the root of the app's local storage.
trans-unit.target: Points to the root of the app's local storage.

trans-unit.source: This is the location referenced by the [ApplicationData.LocalFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241621) property.
trans-unit.target: This is the location referenced by the [ApplicationData.LocalFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241621) property.

trans-unit.source: ms-appdata:///temp
trans-unit.target: ms-appdata:///temp

trans-unit.source: Points to the app's temp folder.
trans-unit.target: Points to the app's temp folder.

trans-unit.source: This is the location referenced by the [ApplicationData.TemporaryFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241629) property.
trans-unit.target: This is the location referenced by the [ApplicationData.TemporaryFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241629) property.

trans-unit.source: The following example loads tiles that are stored as files in the app's installation folder by using the `ms-appx:///` protocol.
trans-unit.target: The following example loads tiles that are stored as files in the app's installation folder by using the `ms-appx:///` protocol.

trans-unit.source: The value for the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636998) is specified in the constructor of the [**LocalMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636994).
trans-unit.target: The value for the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636998) is specified in the constructor of the [**LocalMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636994).

trans-unit.source: In this example, tiles are only displayed when the zoom level of the map is within the range specified by the optional [**ZoomLevelRange**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637171) property.
trans-unit.target: In this example, tiles are only displayed when the zoom level of the map is within the range specified by the optional [**ZoomLevelRange**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637171) property.

trans-unit.source: Provide a custom URI
trans-unit.target: Provide a custom URI

trans-unit.source: If the replaceable parameters available with the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) property of the [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986) or the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636998) property of the [**LocalMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636994) aren't sufficient to retrieve your tiles, then you have to create a custom Uri.
trans-unit.target: If the replaceable parameters available with the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636992) property of the [**HttpMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636986) or the [**UriFormatString**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636998) property of the [**LocalMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636994) aren't sufficient to retrieve your tiles, then you have to create a custom Uri.

trans-unit.source: Create and return a custom Uri by providing a custom handler for the **UriRequested** event.
trans-unit.target: Create and return a custom Uri by providing a custom handler for the **UriRequested** event.

trans-unit.source: The **UriRequested** event is raised for each individual tile.
trans-unit.target: The **UriRequested** event is raised for each individual tile.

trans-unit.source: In your custom handler for the **UriRequested** event, combine the required custom arguments with the [**X**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn610743), [**Y**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn610744), and [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn610745) properties of the [**MapTileUriRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637177) to create the custom Uri.
trans-unit.target: In your custom handler for the **UriRequested** event, combine the required custom arguments with the [**X**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn610743), [**Y**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn610744), and [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn610745) properties of the [**MapTileUriRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637177) to create the custom Uri.

trans-unit.source: Return the custom Uri in the [**Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn610748) property of the [**MapTileUriRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637173), which is contained in the [**Request**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637179) property of the [**MapTileUriRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637177).
trans-unit.target: Return the custom Uri in the [**Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn610748) property of the [**MapTileUriRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637173), which is contained in the [**Request**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637179) property of the [**MapTileUriRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637177).

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to provide a custom Uri by creating a custom handler for the **UriRequested** event.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to provide a custom Uri by creating a custom handler for the **UriRequested** event.

trans-unit.source: It also shows how to implement the deferral pattern if you have to do something asynchronously to create the custom Uri.
trans-unit.target: It also shows how to implement the deferral pattern if you have to do something asynchronously to create the custom Uri.

trans-unit.source: Overlay tiles from a custom source
trans-unit.target: Overlay tiles from a custom source

trans-unit.source: Overlay custom tiles by using the [**CustomMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636983).
trans-unit.target: Overlay custom tiles by using the [**CustomMapTileDataSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636983).

trans-unit.source: Create tiles programmatically in memory on the fly, or write your own code to load existing tiles from another source.
trans-unit.target: Create tiles programmatically in memory on the fly, or write your own code to load existing tiles from another source.

trans-unit.source: To create or load custom tiles, provide a custom handler for the [**BitmapRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636984) event.
trans-unit.target: To create or load custom tiles, provide a custom handler for the [**BitmapRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636984) event.

trans-unit.source: The **BitmapRequested** event is raised for each individual tile.
trans-unit.target: The **BitmapRequested** event is raised for each individual tile.

trans-unit.source: In your custom handler for the [**BitmapRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636984) event, combine the required custom arguments with the [**X**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637135), [**Y**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637136), and [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637137) properties of the [**MapTileBitmapRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637132) to create or retrieve a custom tile.
trans-unit.target: In your custom handler for the [**BitmapRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn636984) event, combine the required custom arguments with the [**X**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637135), [**Y**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637136), and [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637137) properties of the [**MapTileBitmapRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637132) to create or retrieve a custom tile.

trans-unit.source: Return the custom tile in the [**PixelData**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637140) property of the [**MapTileBitmapRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637128), which is contained in the [**Request**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637134) property of the [**MapTileBitmapRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637132).
trans-unit.target: Return the custom tile in the [**PixelData**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637140) property of the [**MapTileBitmapRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637128), which is contained in the [**Request**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637134) property of the [**MapTileBitmapRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637132).

trans-unit.source: The **PixelData** property is of type [**IRandomAccessStreamReference**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701664).
trans-unit.target: The **PixelData** property is of type [**IRandomAccessStreamReference**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701664).

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to provide custom tiles by creating a custom handler for the **BitmapRequested** event.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to provide custom tiles by creating a custom handler for the **BitmapRequested** event.

trans-unit.source: This example creates identical red tiles that are partially opaque.
trans-unit.target: This example creates identical red tiles that are partially opaque.

trans-unit.source: The example ignores the [**X**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637135), [**Y**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637136), and [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637137) properties of the [**MapTileBitmapRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637132).
trans-unit.target: The example ignores the [**X**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637135), [**Y**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637136), and [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637137) properties of the [**MapTileBitmapRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637132).

trans-unit.source: Although this is not a real world example, the example demonstrates how you can create in-memory custom tiles on the fly.
trans-unit.target: Although this is not a real world example, the example demonstrates how you can create in-memory custom tiles on the fly.

trans-unit.source: The example also shows how to implement the deferral pattern if you have to do something asynchronously to create the custom tiles.
trans-unit.target: The example also shows how to implement the deferral pattern if you have to do something asynchronously to create the custom tiles.

trans-unit.source: Replace the default map
trans-unit.target: Replace the default map

trans-unit.source: To replace the default map entirely with third-party or custom tiles:
trans-unit.target: To replace the default map entirely with third-party or custom tiles:

trans-unit.source: Specify [**MapTileLayer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637143).**BackgroundReplacement** as the value of the [**Layer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637157) property of the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144).
trans-unit.target: Specify [**MapTileLayer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637143).**BackgroundReplacement** as the value of the [**Layer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637157) property of the [**MapTileSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637144).

trans-unit.source: Specify [**MapStyle**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637127).**None** as the value of the [**Style**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637051) property of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).
trans-unit.target: Specify [**MapStyle**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637127).**None** as the value of the [**Style**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637051) property of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).
